name: Harishchandragad Trek
overview: Harishchandragad Trek is one of the most iconic and historically rich treks in Maharashtra. Located in the Sahyadri mountain range near Bhandardara, this trek is famous for its massive Konkan Kada cliff, ancient temples, caves, and breathtaking sunrise and sunset views. The trek attracts adventure seekers, photographers, history lovers, and nature enthusiasts from Mumbai and Pune. The trail includes rocky sections, forest paths, and steep ascents, offering a perfect mix of thrill and scenic beauty. During monsoon and winter, the surroundings turn lush green with mist-covered valleys, making Harishchandragad a must-do trek for every trekker.
shortDescription: In essence, Harishchandragad offers a blend of adventure, history, and natural beauty, making it a must-visit trek in Maharashtra.
highlights: Famous Konkan Kada: A massive concave cliff offering breathtaking valley views
Ancient temples and caves showcasing historical significance
Located in the Sahyadri mountain range near Bhandardara
Popular for sunrise and sunset views with mist-covered landscapes
A challenging yet rewarding trek for adventure seekers and photographers
expectations: Views: Panoramic views of Konkan Kada, valleys, forests, and Sahyadri ranges
Difficulty: Moderate to difficult trek with steep ascents and rocky patches
Seasons: Monsoon and Winter are ideal for lush greenery and clear views
gettingThere: From Mumbai, take a local train to Kasara, then travel by local transport to the base village.
excluded: Anything not mentioned in the inclusions

Days.1: Train Boarding Schedule for Mumbai Participants

timings.02:30 AM: Reach base village and have rest
timings.07:30 AM: Reach Harishchandragad and explore Konkan Kada
timings.10:30 AM: Start descending to the base village
timings.04:00 PM: Start return journey to Kasara / Mumbai

thingsToCarry: Trekking shoes or sports shoes with good grip
Ready-to-eat food like dry fruits, biscuits, chikki, chocolates
note: Please wear Full Sleeves and Full Track Pants to protect your body from sun, thorns, insects, and scratches.

name: Kalsubai Trek
overview: Kalsubai Trek is the highest peak of Maharashtra at an altitude of 5,400 feet and is popularly known as the “Everest of Maharashtra.” Located near Bhandardara, this trek offers well-marked trails, iron ladders, and stunning panoramic views of the Sahyadri ranges, dams, and surrounding forts. The trek is suitable for beginners as well as experienced trekkers and is ideal for those looking to experience high-altitude trekking within a day. Sunrise views from the summit are the main highlight of this trek.
shortDescription: The Kalsubai Trek, the highest peak in Maharashtra at 5,400 feet, is called the “Everest of Maharashtra.” Located near Bhandardara, it features well-marked trails, iron ladders, and panoramic views of the Sahyadri ranges, dams, and forts. Suitable for both beginners and experienced trekkers, it offers a memorable high-altitude trekking experience in a single day, with sunrise views from the summit as the main highlight.
highlights: Highest Peak in Maharashtra: Stands at 5,400 feet, earning the nickname 'Everest of Maharashtra.'
Scenic Views: Panoramic vistas of the Sahyadri ranges, nearby dams, and historic forts.
Trekking Experience: Features well-marked trails and iron ladders for adventure seekers.
Suitable for All Levels: Ideal for beginners and experienced trekkers alike.
Day Trek Friendly: Can be completed in a single day.
Sunrise at the Summit: Offers breathtaking sunrise views from the top.
expectations: Challenging Yet Manageable Trek: Moderate difficulty suitable for beginners and experienced trekkers.
Stunning Natural Beauty: Expect panoramic views of the Sahyadri ranges, dams, and surrounding forts.
Adventure Elements: Iron ladders and steep sections add excitement to the trek.
Physical Fitness Required: Prepare for a 5–6 hour round trip with uphill climbs.
Peaceful Sunrise Experience: Early morning trek rewards with breathtaking sunrise from the summit.
Crowd Levels: Can be busy during weekends and festivals, especially Navratri.

timings.03:00 AM: Start the trek to Kalsubai Peak, spotting fireflies along the way
timings.07:00 AM: Reach the summit; relax and explore
timings.09:00 AM: Begin descending via the same route
timings.01:30 PM: Arrive back at the base village and enjoy lunch
timings.06:00 PM: Reach Kasara Station (Arrival time may vary based on group pace and traffic)
timings.06:18 PM: Board the CSMT Fast Local back to Mumbai

thingsToCarry: backpack (waterproof or covered with waterproof cover)
trekking shoes or any sports shoes with a Good grip
Trekking pants (compulsory), 2 T-Shirts (Preferably full sleeves or Half T-shirt with sleeves), Raincoat/ waterproof jacket/ windcheater, Handnapkin/Towel, etc
Ready-to-eat food like plum cakes, Dry fruits, dry snacks and biscuits, Chikki, chocolate bars, etc.
Personal Medicines and Personal First aid
note: Carry enough water, wear sturdy trekking shoes, and start early to avoid crowds and enjoy the sunrise at the summit.
location: Near Bhandardara, Ahmednagar district, Maharashtra, India, within the Kalsubai-Harishchandragad Wildlife Sanctuary.

name: Rajmachi Trek
overview: Rajmachi Trek is one of the most popular treks in Maharashtra, especially during the monsoon season. Located between Lonavala and Karjat, this trek is known for its lush green trails, waterfalls, and the twin forts Shrivardhan and Manaranjan. The trek is beginner-friendly and ideal for first-time trekkers, night treks, and weekend getaways from Mumbai and Pune.

name: Harihar Fort Trek
overview: Harihar Fort Trek is one of the most thrilling and unique treks in Maharashtra. Famous for its steep rock-cut staircase inclined at nearly 80 degrees, this trek offers a challenging yet exciting experience. Located near Nashik, Harihar Fort provides stunning views of surrounding valleys and forts. This trek is ideal for adventure seekers looking for a short but intense trekking experience.

name: Sandhan Valley Trek & Rappelling
overview: Sandhan Valley Trek, also known as the Valley of Shadows, is one of the most adventurous treks in Maharashtra. Located near Bhandardara, this trek involves descending through a narrow rock valley, rappelling, water crossings, and boulder walking. It is a perfect trek for thrill seekers and adventure enthusiasts looking for a unique canyon trekking experience.

name: Andharban Jungle Trek
overview: Andharban Jungle Trek is one of the most refreshing and scenic forest treks in Maharashtra. The name “Andharban” literally means Dark Forest, and the trek truly lives up to its name with dense greenery, tall trees, misty trails, waterfalls, and flowing streams. Located in the Sahyadri range near Bhira and Tamhini Ghat, this trek is especially popular during the monsoon season. Unlike most treks, Andharban is a downhill trek, making it suitable for beginners as well as nature lovers who want to enjoy a relaxed yet adventurous jungle walk. The trek offers breathtaking views of valleys, waterfalls, and the backwaters of Bhira Dam.

name: Aadrai Jungle Trek
overview: Aadrai Jungle Trek is a hidden gem in the Sahyadri ranges, located near Harishchandragad. This trek is known for its untouched forest trails, dense greenery, waterfalls, and river crossings. Aadrai offers a raw jungle trekking experience away from crowded tourist spots. The trek is moderately difficult and is best suited for monsoon season when the forest comes alive with lush vegetation and flowing streams.

name: Kalu Waterfall Trek
overview: Kalu Waterfall Trek offers a mesmerizing view of one of the highest waterfalls in Maharashtra. Located near Malshej Ghat, this trek is known for its powerful waterfall, deep valleys, and dramatic landscapes. The trek is adventurous and recommended only for experienced trekkers during monsoon. Due to heavy rainfall and strong winds, safety precautions are strictly followed on this trek.

name: Nanemachi Waterfall Trek

The trail is easy to moderate, making it suitable for beginners and group treks. The trek is especially popular during monsoon weekends due to its accessibility and scenic charm.

name: Rajgad Trek
overview: Rajgad Trek is one of the most historically significant treks in Maharashtra and was the capital of the Maratha Empire for more than 25 years under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Located near Pune, Rajgad Fort is known for its massive structure, beautiful balekillas, and panoramic views of the Sahyadri mountain ranges. The trek route passes through forests, rocky patches, and scenic trails, making it suitable for beginners as well as experienced trekkers. Rajgad offers a perfect blend of history, adventure, and natural beauty.

name: Torna Fort Trek
overview: Torna Fort Trek leads to the first fort captured by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and holds immense historical importance. Located near Pune, Torna is also one of the highest forts in Maharashtra and offers breathtaking views of the Sahyadri range. The trek is moderately difficult and best suited for trekkers looking for a challenging yet rewarding experience.

name: Korigad Monsoon Trek
overview: Korigad Trek is a beginner-friendly fort trek located near Lonavala. Known for its wide trails, fort walls, and scenic views, this trek is especially popular during the monsoon season. The fort offers beautiful views of Aamby Valley and surrounding hills, making it ideal for families and first-time trekkers.

name: Peb Fort (Vikatgad) Trek
